revised_title: Electron Impact Excitation of Hydrogen Atoms
tldr: The authors used the second Born approximation to calculate cross-sections for the electron impact excitation of the hydrogen atom's 1s level, taking into account distortion and polarization due to intermediate states. They compared their results with available experimental data and found that the effect of distortion and polarization decreases the total cross-section below that of the first Born approximation. The study provides insights into the behavior of the excitation cross-section for positron impact as well.
